name: Transforming Customer Experiences with AI Services (Part 1)
description: Dev Centre House (DCH) An experience from a recent customer engagement on transcribing customer conversations

name: Move a VM based application to Kubernetes. Dev Centre House (DCH)
description: This demo modernizes an existing Java web application (JPetStore) by building a Docker container from the legacy stack. Then moving the app to IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service and extending it with Watson Visual Recognition and Twilio text messaging.

name: How To Install Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP (LAMP) stack on Ubuntu 16.04
description: A LAMP stack is a group of open source software that is typically installed together to enable a server to host dynamic websites and web apps. This term is actually an acronym which represents the Linux operating system, with the Apache web server. The site data is stored in a MySQL database, and dynamic content is processed by PHP.

name: Securing single page apps with App ID service
description: The Investment Insights for Asset Managers offers a dashboard type user interface to allow users to analyze a set of stock portfolios based on the risk factor calculated. The application uses a combination of services like Watson Discovery News, Investment Portfolio, Predictive Market Scenarios and Simulated Instrument Analytics. All of the services configured using Node.js for the backend and AngularJS for the front end.

name: Developing a finance application using IBM Cloud
description: What would happen to my stock portfolio if the Dollar drops 5% against the Euro? or if the gold price goes up by 1.1%? If you are a developer in the Finance industry or a financial analyst, or if you simply own stocks you may be asking yourself the question. How could modern technologies and services help answer this question?

name: 2.2 Deploy and scale a kubernetes chat app on IBM Cloud
description: In the previous BlueChatter post, we looked at deploying and scaling a Node.js chat app using Cloud Foundry and Docker Container approach. In this post, we will look at how to deploy, scale and manage a Kubernetes application. We will reuse the same BlueChatter node.js application for this example.

name: 1.2 Deploy scalable Docker application to IBM Cloud
description: As of May 23rd, IBM Bluemix Container Service now provides a native Kubernetes operations experience while removing the burden of maintaining master nodes. Kubernetes itself is based on the Docker engine for managing software images and instantiating containers. Get the details. As a Bluemix Developer Advocate, I get to work with many developers worldwide who are interested in learning more about IBM Container services. I repeatedly get asked the same questions, so I thought it would be good to answer them with a guide for deploying a docker application to Bluemix and explain why developers should use it.

name: Use Virtual Servers to build highly available and scalable web app
description: IBM Cloud infrastructure services offer a collection of infrastructure services like compute, storage, network, security, VMware and more. With this in place, let’s explore what it takes to build a highly available and scalable web application on IBM Cloud.

name: Automate deployment of environments using Infrastructure as Code
description: IBM Cloud Schematics is a tool that uses Terraform to provision and manages infrastructure resources, Cloud Foundry applications, services, Kubernetes clusters and much more using the code in a configuration file(s). To showcase these aspects, we added a new tutorial to our collection. In this tutorial, you will use a provided template in Schematics to provision a Linux virtual server, with Apache web server, MySQL, and PHP server (LAMP stack) and Object Storage. You will then configure the template to scale the resources and tune the environment (memory, CPU, and disk size). Finish by deleting all of the resources created by the configuration. You will learn all about Cloud Schematics (Infrastructure as Code).

name: Featured code samples on new IBM Cloud GitHub repository
description: There are hundreds of code samples all over the web for developing on IBM Cloud. This is great, but it can be difficult to find a good working code samples that are managed and maintained. With the new ibm-bluemix.github.io, we overcome this challenge by creating a central place where you can to find selected code samples for developing on IBM.

name: Form Processing With Cloud Functions
description: The OpenWhiskContact application is a simple Angular.js form processing app that shows how a form can be processed without the need of any backend, this is by using the IBM OpenWhisk Serverless architecture where an action is created then exposed as an API and then used in the Angular app.

name: Migrate an application from Azure to IBM Cloud
description: IBM Cloud is an implementation of IBM’s Open Cloud Architecture, leveraging Cloud Foundry to enable developers to rapidly build, deploy, and manage applications and services. Although Microsoft Azure, another popular PaaS platform, shares quite a few similarities with Cloud Foundry, several elements still need to be addressed when porting Microsoft Azure applications to IBM Bluemix.

name: Deploying a CRUD PHP application to IBM Cloud
description: PHP developers still spend a lot of time configuring systems and servers to get a PHP application up and running. PHP developers usually go through this lifecycle every time starting a project. Luckily, Bluemix services and runtimes take all this grunt work out of creating web applications.
